section.title: ToKuMX
section.para: eXo JCR provides the way to persist workspace data on NOSQL database as ToKuMX . This article describes the required configuration.

section.title: JCR Workspace Data Container
section.para: To use TokuMX database as persistent storage, you should use MXWorkspaceDataContainer as DataContainer. The type of container is described in the attribute class = org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.storage.tokumx.MXWorkspaceDataContainer.
section.programlisting: <container class="org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.storage.tokumx.MXWorkspaceDataContainer"> <properties> <property name="max-buffer-size" value="200k" /> <property name="swap-directory" value="target/temp/swap/ws" /> <property name="collection-name-suffix" value="db1ws" /> <property name="use-sequence-for-order-number" value="${use-sequence}" /> <property name="auto-commit" value="${auto-commit}" /> <property name="connection-transactionsuri" value="${connection-uri}" /> ... </properties>

listitem.para: max-buffer-size: A threshold in bytes, if a value size is greater, then it will be spooled to a temporary file. Default value is 200k.
swap-directory: A location where the value will be spooled if no value storage is configured but a max-buffer-size is exceeded. Default value is the value of "java.io.tmpdir" system property.

itemizedlist.listitem:
transactions
collection-name-suffix: The suffix name of the collection used to persist workspace data.

listitem.para: use-sequence-for-order-number: Indicates whether or not a sequence must be used to manage the order number. The value expected for this parameter is a boolean by default it is set to "TRUE".
auto-commit: Enable autocommit mode for the current connection. By default autocommit mode is disabled.
connection-uri: The connection URI used to connect to ToKuMX database server.

section.title: GridFS Value Storage
section.para: Instead of storing a file in a single document, GridFS divides a file into parts or chunks, and stores each of those chunks as a separate document.
GridFS stores files in two collections:

itemizedlist.listitem: chunks stores the binary chunks. For details.
files stores the fileâ€™s metadata. For details.

section.para: To enable GridFS Value Storage, just configure it in JCR Repositories configuration as we do for other Value Storage.
section.programlisting: <value-storages> <value-storage id="ws" class="org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.storage.value.gfs.GridFSValueStorage"> <properties> <property name="connection-uri" value="${connection-uri}" /> <property name="enabled" value="${value-storage-enabled}" /> </properties> <filters> <filter property-type="Binary" /> </filters> </value-storage> </value-storages>

listitem.para: connection-uri: The connection URI used to connect to ToKuMX database server.

section.title: LockManager configuration
section.para: ISPNCacheableLockManagerImpl stores Lock objects in Infinispan, Also, Infinispan has a TokuMXCacheStore, so Locks will be stored to the ToKuMX database.You can enable LockManager by adding lock-manager-configuration to workspace-configuration.
section.programlisting: <lock-manager class="org.exoplatform.services.jcr.impl.core.lock.tokumx.ISPNCacheableLockManagerImpl"> <properties> <property name="time-out" value="15m" /> <property name="infinispan-configuration" value="conf/standalone/test-infinispan-lock.xml" /> <property name="infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.connection.uri" value="${connection-uri}" /> <property name="infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.auto.commit" value="${auto-commit}" /> <property name="infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.collection.name" value="db1ws" /> </properties> </lock-manager>

listitem.para: infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.connection.uri: The connection URI used to connect to ToKuMX database server.
infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.auto.commit: Enable autocommit mode for the current connection. By default autocommit mode is disabled.
infinispan-configuration: defines path to template based configuration for Infinispan Cache instance.

section.title: Lock template configuration
section.para: The template Infinispan configuration to use for all LockManagers.
section.programlisting:
<infinispan xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="urn:infinispan:config:5.2 http://www.infinispan.org/schemas/infinispan-config-5.2.xsd" xmlns="urn:infinispan:config:5.2">
<global> <globalJmxStatistics jmxDomain="exo" enabled="true" allowDuplicateDomains="true"/> </global>
<default> <locking isolationLevel="READ_COMMITTED" lockAcquisitionTimeout="20000" writeSkewCheck="false" concurrencyLevel="500" useLockStriping="false"/> <transaction transactionManagerLookupClass="org.exoplatform.services.transaction.infinispan.JBossStandaloneJTAManagerLookup" syncRollbackPhase="true" syncCommitPhase="true" transactionMode="TRANSACTIONAL"/> <jmxStatistics enabled="true"/>eXo JCR can rely storage persistence on NOSQL database as ToKuMX
<loaders passivation="false" shared="true" preload="true"> <store class="org.exoplatform.services.jcr.tokumx.TokuMXCacheStore" fetchPersistentState="true" ignoreModifications="false" purgeOnStartup="false"> <properties> <property name="connectionURI" value="${infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.connection.uri}"/> <property name="collectionName" value="${infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.collection.name}"/> </properties> <async enabled="false"/> </store> </loaders> </default>
</infinispan>
section.para: All configurable parameters are filled by templates and will be replaced by LockManagers configuration parameters:

listitem.para: infinispan-cl-cache.mongodb.connection.uri: The connection URI used to connect to ToKuMX database server.
